alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 06 at 1:23PM PST until January 08 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves with dangerous rip currents. High surf of 7 to 15 feet for Ventura County, Catalina Island, and Santa Barbara County Southwest Coast, highest near Point Conception. High surf 5 to 9 feet elsewhere for Los Angeles County. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Ventura County Beaches and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches
